page.title: 08THE PRIORY
page.content: The Priory started construction in 1412 after the Augustinian monks from Hastings became unpopular and moved inland.The monks stayed there until 1537 whenthe Proiry church was dissoluted and the Priory was given by Henry the eighth to his Attorney General, Sir John Baker.The Priory is a Grade 1 listed building it was used as a monastery for 123 years. In 1976 it was opened as a hotel.The Priory own approx.400 acres of land.There are quite afew legends concerning the Priory.One is about two brothers in a personal duel,both had swords and one slashed his brothers jaw off but received a blow to the head so one skull has a jaw missing the other the cranium.The skull is now kept in a cupboard in one of the rooms of the Priory.There is only one skull because the other is missing!
